subject: Gardening
title: Climate Gardens: Planting for the Future
description: A fast breakdown of Climate Gardens: Planting for the Future for builders.

hook.text: By 2050, London's climate will resemble Barcelona's. Today's gardeners must pick plants for a future climate.

buildup.text: Climate-adapted gardening means shifting plant palettes: Mediterranean species moving north.

discovery.text: RHS trials show olive trees, agapanthus, and cannas now survive outdoors year-round in southern England.

twist.text: The challenge isn't just heatâ€”it's chaos. Mild winters then late frosts kill plants adapted to stable warmth.

climax.text: Climate gardening is forward-looking: planting not for today's conditions but for the world our children inherit.

punchline.text: Plant for 2050's climate, not today's. The future is already here.

quiz.question: What is the main challenge of climate-adapted gardening beyond rising temperatures?
options: Finding enough water for drought-adapted Mediterranean plants
Erratic weather patterns where mild winters are followed by late frosts
Soil in northern regions being too acidic for Mediterranean species
